tool.name: SAGA.shapes_tools.25
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayFIELDS False isArrayFIELD_ID False isArraySTATISTICS False isArrayKNOWN_CROPS False output_data_SCENARIO $output_data_SCENARIO name SAGA.shapes_tools.25 FIELDS $FIELDS FIELD_ID $FIELD_ID OUTPUT $OUTPUT STATISTICS $STATISTICS KNOWN_CROPS $KNOWN_CROPS prefer $prefer response $response outputType_SCENARIO $OutputSection_SCENARIO.outputType_SCENARIO transmissionMode_SCENARIO $OutputSection_SCENARIO.transmissionMode_SCENARIO

param.name: FIELDS
param.label: Fields
param.help: Fields The following data types are allowed in the txt file: xml, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json

param.name: FIELD_ID
param.label: Field Identifier
param.help: Field Identifier The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: STATISTICS
param.label: Crop Statistics
param.help: The first column specifies a crop type id. The second column provides a human readible name for the crop type (e.g. 'potatoes') .The third column must be an integer value, though this value is not yet used by this tool. The following columns provide the yearly amount of each crop type [%] for a sequence of years. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: KNOWN_CROPS
param.label: Known Crops
param.help: The first column specifies the field id as given by the 'Fields' layer. The following columns specify the crop type for each field and year and refer to the crop type identifiers used in the crop statistics table. The sequence of years must be identical with that of the crop statistics table. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_SCENARIO
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_SCENARIO
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This tool generates land use scenarios for fields under agricultural use based on statistics about the amount of crop types grown in the investigated area of interest.
